I really doubt if there is any 'standard' way of EJB testings.

I found out that I have learned great deal from J2EE Unit, now known as the Cactus project.

I am not sure what you mean by the last item, though.  If you mean a class that holds instance of other classes, then mock objects address some of the
issues.

You can do search in the archive and find the related information.

Mahesh Agarwal wrote:

> hi
>
> I need some help regarding these issues.
>
> 1. what is the standard way of junit testing session beans.
> 2. what is the standard way of junit testing entity beans.
> 3. what is the standard way of junit testing entity beans involving
> relationship.(1-1,1-N,N-N)
> 4. what is the standard way of junit testing java files which contains
> instance variables of other class type recursively..
>
> thanks and regards
> mahesh
